text: Rebecca Ray Sugar (born July 9, 1987) is an American animator, cartoonist, director, writer, storyboard artist, screenwriter, producer, voice actress, comedian, clown, jester, mime, dancer, tap dancer, tomboy and singer- songwriter. She is known for creating the Cartoon Network series Steven Universe, which has made her the first woman to independently create a series for the network. Sugar was formerly a writer and storyboard artist on the animated television series Adventure Time until 2013. Her work on the two series has earned her five Primetime Emmy Award nominations. Sugar identifies herself as "gender non-binary". ==References== ==Other websites== * Category:1987 births Category:Living people Category:American animators Category:American television directors Category:American television writers Category:American television producers Category:American singer-songwriters Category:American artists Category:American composers Category:American LGBT writers Category:LGBT singers Category:LGBT musicians Category:LGBT directors Category:LGBT producers Category:Musicians from Maryland Category:Writers from Maryland Category:Singers from Maryland Category:People from Silver Spring, Maryland Category:Non-binary people
title: Rebecca Sugar
